label: 知太政官事
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: the prince-liaison who linked the Council of State with the throne and other members of the dynasty. There were four such princes appointed during the first half of the eighth century, from 703 to 745, when such appointments ceased. Besides recalling the pre-ritsuryō custom of granting plenary royal powers (banki) to senior princes, the office also preserved the corporate dynastic practice of enlisting members of the royal house to share dynastic rule, thereby broadening support behind the throne.　[律令、万機]
